page.title: 06FARMING :OIL SEED RAPE
page.content: {OIL SEED RAPE}WAS A{MINOR}CROP IN THE{1970'S.}NOW,SEVERAL YEARS LATER, THIS CROP IS GROWING IN IMPORTANCE. WHILE LOOKING OVER THE LANDSCAPE, IT LOOKS LIKE A HUGE PATCHWORK QUILT WITH VAST SQUARES OF YELLOW,BUT IF YOU LOOK MORE CLOSELY AT THE CROP IN THE MONTH OF MAY YOU WILL FIND THAT IT HAS SMALL YELLOW FLOWERS. {THREE}FARMS,IN THE AREA TO THE NORTH OF FORFAR, WHICH GROW OIL SEED RAPE ARE{WARDMILL, QUILKOE}AND {BLAIRYFEDDON.} THE FARMERS OF EACH WILL SOW THE CROP IN{AUTUMN}AND BY LATE{APRIL}THE STEM AND FLOWER WILL HAVE APPEARED. IN{JUNE}OR EARLY{JULY}THE FLOWERS WILL HAVE DIED BACK AND THE JOB OF HARVESTING WILL BEGIN IN{AUGUST.} THE OIL SEED RAPE WILL THEN BE SENT SOUTH TO BE CRUSHED FOR{EDIBLE FAT.
